CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: In the out - of - plane of PQCDTB , as shown Figure 1a , a sharp diffraction peak was observed at 4.0 , 8.1 , 12.2 ° , which indicates the formation of ordered lamellar structure as an out - of - plane peak ( h00 ) by the alkyl side chain of quinacridone and conventional edge-on πstacking. 5,14,23 The lamellar d-spacing ( d 1 ) was 21.8 Å ( λ = 2d[sin θ ] ). In the ( 010 ) in-plane pattern related to π-π stacking , as shown Figure 1b , a broad diffraction peak was detected at approximately 24.0 ° . Using the same calculation , the π-π stacking distance ( d π ) was 3.7 Å. The results are similar to thiophene and thiophene - fused aromatic system polymers that perform well as OPVs. 19,25 In the out - of - plane of PCZDTB , as shown in Figure 1a , no diffraction peak was observed in the thin film. As reported before , a broad diffraction peak was observed at approximately 20.5 ° in the diffraction of powdery PCZDTB ( see Supporting Information ). 26 The π-π stacking distance ( d π ) was 4.3 Å. The result was similar to the result for π-π stacking ( d π = 4.0 - 4.4 Å ) of fluorene-thiophene. The benzene-thiophene linkage has a twisted structure compared with the thiophenethiophene linkage. The structure has an impact on π-π stacking ( d π ) as well. 27 By calculating PCZDTB and PQCDTB using a density functional theory ( DFT ) calculation , the tilt angle has been comparatively analyzed. In terms of tilt angle , PCZDTB was 27-28 ° , while PQCDTB was 19-21 ° . Compared with PCZDTB , formation of a planar backbone and stronger π-π stacking were observed in PQCDTB ( see Supporting Information ). On the basis of this result , it has been confirmed that π-π stacking was more effective in PQCDTB than in PCZDTB because of coplanarity of the quinacridone unit that was introduced to the main chain of PQCDTB. 13 Figure 2 showed the UV - visible spectra of PQCDTB and PCZDTB. As shown in Figure 2 , the maximum absorption peak of PQCDTB ( λ max ) was observed at 389 and 539 nm , respectively , in solution ( 10^-6 M in chloroform ). On the other hand , the maximum absorption peaks of PCZDTB ( λ max ) were observed at 386 and 514 nm in solution. The band around 380 nm in the absorption spectra of PQCDTB and PCZDTB can be assigned to π-π* transition whereas the 530-550 band are due to intramolecular charge transfer ( ICT ) between donor and acceptor moieties. 10 The absorption spectrum of PQCDTB is broadened and red - shifted compared to that of PCZDTB. This can be explained by the much stronger ICT effects in the PQCDTB than that in PCZDTB.

Let's think step by step.

1. Quinacridone (PQCDTB)
2. Conventional edge-on πstacking
3. Alkyl side chain of quinacridone
4. Thiophene
5. Thiophene-fused aromatic system polymers
6. PCZDTB
7. Fluorene-thiophene
8. Benzene-thiophene linkage
9. Thiophenethiophene linkage
10. Density functional theory (DFT) calculation
11. PCZDTB (mentioned twice)
12. PQCDTB (mentioned twice)

These are the material names identified in the paragraph.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Name.

1. Quinacridone (PQCDTB)
2. Thiophene
3. PCZDTB
4. Fluorene-thiophene
5. Benzene-thiophene linkage
6. Thiophenethiophene linkage

These are the material names that clearly refer to specific substances in the paragraph.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| Quinacridone (PQCDTB) |
| Thiophene |
| PCZDTB |
| Fluorene-thiophene |
| Benzene-thiophene linkage |
| Thiophenethiophene linkage |

The results are similar to thiophene and thiophene - fused aromatic system polymers that perform well as OPVs. 19,25 In the out - of - plane of PCZDTB , as shown in Figure 1a , no diffraction peak was observed in the thin film. As reported before , a broad diffraction peak was observed at approximately 20.5 ° in the diffraction of powdery PCZDTB ( see Supporting Information ). 26 The π-π stacking distance ( d π ) was 4.3 Å. The result was similar to the result for π-π stacking ( d π = 4.0 - 4.4 Å ) of fluorene-thiophene. The benzene-thiophene linkage has a twisted structure compared with the thiophenethiophene linkage. On the other hand , the maximum absorption peaks of PCZDTB ( λ max ) were observed at 386 and 514 nm in solution. This can be explained by the much stronger ICT effects in the PQCDTB than that in PCZDTB.

4. maximum absorption peak wavelengths (λ max) for PQCDTB and PCZDTB in solution
5. band wavelengths for π-π* transition and intramolecular charge transfer (ICT) in absorption spectra of PQCDTB and PCZDTB.

PV.content:
Please identify the Values (number + unit) of material properties in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: In the out - of - plane of PQCDTB , as shown Figure 1a , a sharp diffraction peak was observed at 4.0 , 8.1 , 12.2 ° , which indicates the formation of ordered lamellar structure as an out - of - plane peak ( h00 ) by the alkyl side chain of quinacridone and conventional edge-on πstacking. 5,14,23 The lamellar d-spacing ( d 1 ) was 21.8 Å ( λ = 2d[sin θ ] ). In the ( 010 ) in-plane pattern related to π-π stacking , as shown Figure 1b , a broad diffraction peak was detected at approximately 24.0 ° . Using the same calculation , the π-π stacking distance ( d π ) was 3.7 Å. The results are similar to thiophene and thiophene - fused aromatic system polymers that perform well as OPVs. 19,25 In the out - of - plane of PCZDTB , as shown in Figure 1a , no diffraction peak was observed in the thin film. As reported before , a broad diffraction peak was observed at approximately 20.5 ° in the diffraction of powdery PCZDTB ( see Supporting Information ). 26 The π-π stacking distance ( d π ) was 4.3 Å. The result was similar to the result for π-π stacking ( d π = 4.0 - 4.4 Å ) of fluorene-thiophene. The benzene-thiophene linkage has a twisted structure compared with the thiophenethiophene linkage. The structure has an impact on π-π stacking ( d π ) as well. 27 By calculating PCZDTB and PQCDTB using a density functional theory ( DFT ) calculation , the tilt angle has been comparatively analyzed. In terms of tilt angle , PCZDTB was 27-28 ° , while PQCDTB was 19-21 ° . Compared with PCZDTB , formation of a planar backbone and stronger π-π stacking were observed in PQCDTB ( see Supporting Information ). On the basis of this result , it has been confirmed that π-π stacking was more effective in PQCDTB than in PCZDTB because of coplanarity of the quinacridone unit that was introduced to the main chain of PQCDTB. 13 Figure 2 showed the UV - visible spectra of PQCDTB and PCZDTB. As shown in Figure 2 , the maximum absorption peak of PQCDTB ( λ max ) was observed at 389 and 539 nm , respectively , in solution ( 10^-6 M in chloroform ). On the other hand , the maximum absorption peaks of PCZDTB ( λ max ) were observed at 386 and 514 nm in solution. The band around 380 nm in the absorption spectra of PQCDTB and PCZDTB can be assigned to π-π* transition whereas the 530-550 band are due to intramolecular charge transfer ( ICT ) between donor and acceptor moieties. 10 The absorption spectrum of PQCDTB is broadened and red - shifted compared to that of PCZDTB. This can be explained by the much stronger ICT effects in the PQCDTB than that in PCZDTB.

Let's think step by step.

1. PQCDTB and PCZDTB: These are the names of two different polymers. They are not material properties, but identifiers.
2. 4.0, 8.1, 12.2 °: These are angles in degrees. They represent the positions of the sharp diffraction peaks observed in the out-of-plane pattern of PQCDTB.
3. 21.8 Å (λ = 2d[sin θ]): This is the lamellar d-spacing (d1) of PQCDTB. The unit is Angstroms (Å).
4. 3.7 Å: This is the π-π stacking distance (dπ) of PQCDTB in the in-plane pattern related to π-π stacking. The unit is Angstroms (Å).
5. 20.5 °: This is an angle in degrees. It is mentioned that a broad diffraction peak was observed at approximately this angle in the diffraction of powdery PCZDTB.
6. 4.3 Å: This is the π-π stacking distance (dπ) of PCZDTB. The unit is Angstroms (Å).
7. 27-28 ° and 19-21 °: These are tilt angles in degrees for PCZDTB and PQCDTB, respectively.
8. 389 and 539 nm: These are wavelengths in nanometers (nm) for the maximum absorption peaks of PQCDTB in solution.
9. 386 and 514 nm: These are wavelengths in nanometers (nm) for the maximum absorption peaks of PCZDTB in solution.
10. 380 nm: This is a wavelength in nanometers (nm) for the band assigned to π-π* transition in the absorption spectra of PQCDTB and PCZDTB.
11. 530-550 nm: These are wavelength ranges in nanometers (nm) for the bands due to intramolecular charge transfer (ICT) between donor and acceptor moieties in the absorption spectra of PQCDTB and PCZDTB.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Value of Material Property.

1. 21.8 Å (d1) - lamellar d-spacing of PQCDTB
2. 3.7 Å (dπ) - π-π stacking distance of PQCDTB in the in-plane pattern
3. 4.3 Å (dπ) - π-π stacking distance of PCZDTB
4. 27-28 ° - tilt angle of PCZDTB
5. 19-21 ° - tilt angle of PQCDTB
6. 389 nm - maximum absorption peak wavelength of PQCDTB in solution for π-π* transition
7. 539 nm - maximum absorption peak wavelength of PQCDTB in solution for intramolecular charge transfer (ICT)
8. 386 nm - maximum absorption peak wavelength of PCZDTB in solution for π-π* transition
9. 514 nm - maximum absorption peak wavelength of PCZDTB in solution for intramolecular charge transfer (ICT)

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Value".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Property Value |
| --- |
| Lamellar d-spacing of PQCDTB: 21.8 Å (d1) |
| π-π stacking distance of PQCDTB (in-plane pattern): 3.7 Å (dπ) |
| π-π stacking distance of PCZDTB: 4.3 Å (dπ) |
| Tilt angle of PCZDTB: 27-28 ° |
| Tilt angle of PQCDTB: 19-21 ° |
| Maximum absorption peak wavelength of PQCDTB in solution for π-π* transition: 389 nm |
| Maximum absorption peak wavelength of PQCDTB in solution for intramolecular charge transfer (ICT): 539 nm |
| Maximum absorption peak wavelength of PCZDTB in solution for π-π* transition: 386 nm |
| Maximum absorption peak wavelength of PCZDTB in solution for intramolecular charge transfer (ICT): 514 nm |
